thread.title: Georgia lottery: 10 co-workers claim $1M ticket sold in Woodstock
thread.title_full: Georgia lottery: 10 co-workers claim $1M ticket sold in Woodstock

author: Ben Brasch
title: Georgia lottery: 10 co-workers claim $1M ticket sold in Woodstock
text:
You know that office lottery pool you’ve turned down because it seemed like a waste of money? Well, it wasn’t for 10 metro Atlanta co-workers.
Their winning $1 million Powerball ticket was sold at AM PM Woodstock convenience store and BP at Trickum and Alabama roads .
The employees work at American Honda Motor Company, which has its power equipment headquarters in Alpharetta.
After 2 months, mystery winners claim $83M lotto ticket sold in Cobb
One of the lucky members claimed the prize at the Duluth office of the Georgia Lottery on Friday, two days after the numbers were drawn.
Dennis Burgess, a 39-year-old stock and material handler, recounted the moment he found out.
How much does Georgia tax lottery winnings? 7-time lottery winner shares tips for winning Powerball
What is the Powerball jackpot; where can you play?
“I was sitting in the parking lot when I checked the numbers online,” he said. “I couldn’t believe it.”
Burgess rushed to tell his co-workers about their prize.
“Everyone was excited. We’re just trying to take it all in,” he said.
Burgess and other winners declined to have photos taken when they claimed the prize.
Feeling lucky? Travel to these four casinos closest to Atlanta
The group’s first five numbers — 5-28-33-38-42 — were right, but they didn’t get the Powerball of 19.
That put the Powerball jackpot at $403 million. Keep track of the winning Powerball numbers online .
Check out some other Cobbers who have recently had a good day:
On Jan. 18, a 66-year-old communications engineer from Marietta won $450,000 . A Powder Springs man won a new Kia Soul during an Atlanta Hawks game Jan. 23 thanks to the lottery’s Cash4Life second-chance drawing . A recently-formed LLC claimed a prize of $83 million on Jan. 19 after two months of waiting after being sold at a Marietta gas station. Also a nearby winner, a 64-year-old Dallas woman claimed her $7.5 million lottery prize in October three months after learning she’d won because she wanted time to plan . Tips on Winning the Lottery
